title.rendered: Deloitte Scholarship 2025 – One Young World Summit, Munich [18-30; Nov 2-6]: Apply by April 16

content.rendered:
Applications are invited for the Deloitte Scholarship 2025 – One Young World Summit, Munich. The application deadline is April 16, 2025!

About Deloitte Scholarship

Today’s global challenges require bold, innovative solutions that leverage technology to create a more sustainable and equitable future for both people and the planet.

Among the most pressing issues are the climate crisis and the protection of natural ecosystems. Advances in artificial intelligence (AI) and emerging technologies provide significant opportunities to drive climate solutions—whether through optimizing energy efficiency, developing predictive climate models, or enabling smarter, data-driven decision-making. However, as AI grows, it is essential to address its potential to increase energy consumption and resource demands, which could lead to higher greenhouse gas emissions. Ensuring the sustainable deployment of these technologies is critical to maximizing their benefits while protecting the planet.

Image Source

Equally important is equipping the next generation with the skills needed to tackle these challenges. The dual digital and green transition requires substantial investment in both green and digital skills, enabling individuals, nations, and societies to thrive in an increasingly dynamic world. Yet millions still lack access to quality education and the skills required for success. By leveraging innovative solutions, we can bridge these gaps, support entrepreneurial ventures, and create new employment pathways in the digital economy.

At Deloitte, we are committed to building a better, more sustainable future, where every individual is empowered to achieve their full potential. Through our strategic initiatives, WorldClass and WorldClimate, we aim to expand opportunities for 100 million people globally by 2030 and address climate change both within and outside our organization.

As a proud partner of One Young World, Deloitte is excited to support the Deloitte Scholarships 2025, which will bring together eight young leaders—four focused on education and four on climate—to attend the One Young World Summit in Munich, Germany, from November 3-6, 2025.

This scholarship is designed for young leaders who are driving innovative solutions to combat climate change and protect natural ecosystems or transform education and skills development for the future workforce.

The organization is looking for candidates who have shown a strong commitment to:

Leveraging innovative solutions to combat climate change, for example:

    • Developing AI-driven or technological solutions that reduce carbon emissions and promote sustainability.
    • Ensuring the sustainable deployment of AI solutions by developing innovative methods to reduce energy and water consumption in AI systems, promoting responsible resource use, and mitigating electronic waste.
    • Protecting and restoring biodiversity by monitoring ecosystems, preventing deforestation, reducing habitat destruction, or supporting conservation efforts.
    • Using data science, machine learning, or automation to predict and mitigate climate risks.

    Transforming education and skills development through innovation, for example:

    • Using AI or technology to improve access to quality education and bridge skills gaps – particularly digital skills gaps – for underrepresented groups, including women, girls, and disadvantaged youth.
    • Developing innovative education and training solutions that equip individuals with future-proof skills to ensure they can thrive in our evolving digital economies.
    • Expanding education and training programs to include green skills, preparing individuals for jobs in the sustainable economy.
    • Promoting upskilling initiatives that foster social entrepreneurship and innovation.

    Deloitte Scholars will receive

    • Access to the One Young World Summit 2025 in Munich.
    • Travel restrictions permitting:
    • Hotel accommodation in a private room between 2 – 6 November 2025 (inclusive)
    • The cost of travel to and from Munich (economy class)
    • Catering which includes breakfast, lunch, and dinner (provided by the hotel and during the Summit)
    • Ground transportation between Summit venues
    • Participation in Deloitte-hosted sessions for their delegation in the lead-up to and during the Summit, and a Deloitte “buddy.”

    Eligibility Criteria

    Candidates must be:

    • Aged 18 – 30*.
    • Nationals of all countries will be eligible to apply for this scholarship, but must be based where Deloitte has a presence,
    • Evidenced commitment to delivering positive change,
    • Demonstrated capacity for leadership,
    • Understanding of key local and/or global issues,
    • Track record of generating impactful and innovative solutions to address either climate and environmental challenges, or education and skills-based challenges.

    *Most delegates are between the ages of 18 and 30. The One Young World  team will consider applications from those who are older than 30, pending  demonstration of appropriate personal impact, initiative, and willingness to engage. We are not able to accept applications from those who will be aged under 18 at the time of the Summit. 

    How to Apply?

    Interested and eligible candidates can apply via this link.

    Deadline

    April 16, 2025.
